metadata.title: CVE-2019-15031 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel through 5.2.14 on the powerpc platform, a local usercan read vector registers of other users' processes via an interrupt. Toexploit the venerability, a local user starts a transaction (via thehardware transactional memory instruction tbegin) and then accesses vectorregisters. At some point, the vector registers will be corrupted with thevalues from a different local Linux process, because MSR_TM_ACTIVE ismisused in arch/powerpc/kernel/process.c.
